revised_title: Changes in Carapace Dimensions of Carcinus maenas
tldr: The author studied the changes in the dimensions of the carapace of Carcinus maenas, a type of crab, over a period of three years. They found that the average frontal breadth of the crabs decreased, while the right dentary margin increased during this time. The author suggests that this may indicate a permanent change in the species or a temporary oscillation in their dimensions, and recommends further measurements to determine the cause.
